messages.message: how can I easily get an enterprise/community setup on Crafting / dogfood? I am using <mailto:admin@instabase.com|admin@instabase.com> for the moment?

Paul has a bunch of accounts he made for us to share if you want to use one of those! If you search crafting in 1pass you should find them. There are more accounts in the descriptions of the items. You can then use those org admin accounts to create your own account if you want.
My crafting is connected to dogfood, so these logins do not seem to work? :confused:

With dogfood (IB Classic) I think you should get your manager to invite you normally. I went to invite you, but you already have an account.

If you want to use AI Hub, you need to connect your crafting sandbox to crafting-aihub's database instead, OR use a local database.

I do the latter.

For the local database, would that mean overriding the `instabase_backend_db_params`  in the env-local-overrides to this:
```"instabase_backend_db_params": "--dialect=sqlite3 --url=/tmp/unittest.db"```
No worries, yeah I use the dev template

@jordy.vlan SQLite is for testing only; you should use mysql or postgres. Here's what I do:

```ppy start mysql # (get mysql started)```
env-local-overrides.json:
```"instabase_backend_db_params": "--dialect=mysql --hostname=localhost --username=root --database=ibdb"```
Create the schema
```make -C shared-utils/go-utils/src/instabase/utils/db db-dev-init```
OR you can try my template (mfichman-ibdev-docker) which sets all this up automatically.
I am really trying to get the template mainstreamed as `ibdev-backend` , but it needs more testing first. I just finished work on it last week.
